definition: to lose one's voice/(to cry out) involuntarily

sentences.english: Was sitting on the floor and cry?
I had never seen a grown man break down and cry.
sentences.chinese: 我从未曾看到过一个这么强壮的汉子痛哭失声。

sentences.english: At GaoYiFei sitting on the ground, holding the head down and cry.
sentences.chinese: 高一飞一下子坐在地上，抱着头痛哭失声。

sentences.english: One day, I realize from experience to am choked with tears am what kind.
sentences.chinese: 某一天，我体悟到痛哭失声是怎样的。

sentences.english: They all said that the true facts, Cao Cao cried aphonia, orders funeral Jinshi.
sentences.chinese: 大家说了实情，曹操痛哭失声，命令厚葬近侍。

sentences.english: A security guard watches as a relative of a fire victim breaks down.
sentences.chinese: 一位遇难者的亲属失声痛哭，一名保安在一边观看。

sentences.english: I hingzheimeris disease never seen a grown man fail and cry.
sentences.chinese: 我从不曾看到过一个这么健旺的汉子痛哭失声。

sentences.english: He broke down and wept when he heard the news.
sentences.chinese: 听到这个消息他不禁失声痛哭。

sentences.english: He has hoarse and has lost his voice sometimes.
I leaned against the stall and cried.
sentences.chinese: 我靠在隔间上，失声痛哭。

sentences.english: Marianna, the duke's daughter, became mute after a shock.
sentences.chinese: 公爵的女儿玛丽安娜在遭受了一次电击后失声了。

sentences.english: wailed Meg, looking with despair at the uneven frizzle on her forehead.
sentences.chinese: 玫绝望地看着额前那参差不齐的刘海儿，痛苦失声。

sentences.english: I had lost my voice and put on a lot of weight, about thirty pounds.
sentences.chinese: 我嗓子失声了，体重增加了大概30磅之多。

sentences.english: He was watching a sitcom laughing quietly from time to time. She asked
sentences.chinese: 他正在看一部情景喜剧，并不时地失声笑出来。

sentences.english: Yesterday afternoon, Zhoumaoxiang parents choked with tears.
sentences.chinese: 昨日下午，周茂祥的父母失声痛哭。

sentences.english: He burst into laughter in spite of himself.
sentences.chinese: 他不由自主地失声笑了出来。

definition: to cry out in alarm or surprise
very loudly/at the top of one's voice
trill (of voice)/see also 顫聲|颤声[zhan4 sheng1]
trembling voice/see also 顫聲|颤声[chan4 sheng1]
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
